1.text: Fry 5 strips of bacon in a skillet over medium heat until they're crispy.

2.text: Transfer the fried bacon to a paper towel-lined plate.

3.text: Shred 1/2 a head of cabbage and chop 1 potato into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) pieces.

4.text: Add the cabbage, potato, salt, and pepper to the skillet.

5.text: Cover the skillet and fry the mixture over medium heat for 7 to 8 minutes.

6.text: Stir in the garlic and cook the uncovered mixture for 1 minute.

7.text: Turn off the burner and stir in the crispy bacon pieces.

8.text: Wrap the bacon and peppercorns in 1 cabbage leaf.

9.text: Fold the leaf over to cover the bacon and wrap it with kitchen twine.

10.text: Cut the cabbage in 1/2 and trim away the white core.

11.text: Put the cabbage leaves into a colander and rinse them under cold water.

12.text: Peel 1 potato and cut it into 2 in (5.1 cm) chunks.

13.text: Fill a pot half full of salted water and bring it to a boil.

14.text: Add the potato chunks and cook them over medium-high heat for 10 minutes.

15.text: Add the bacon packet and cabbage and simmer it for 20 minutes.

16.text: Drain the cabbage and potatoes into a colander.

17.text: Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and cut 1 cabbage into quarters.

18.text: Cut 2 large potatoes into 2 in (5.1 cm) chunks.

19.text: Arrange the cabbage and potatoes in a roasting pan.

20.text: Fry 3⁄4 pound (340 g) of chopped bacon over medium heat for 7 minutes.

21.text: Add 2 cups (300 g) of sliced onions to the skillet and cook them for 5 minutes.

22.text: Spread the bacon and onion mixture over the vegetables.

23.text: Pour chicken stock over the mixture and add salt and pepper.

24.text: Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake it for 1 1/2 hours.

25.text: Remove the pan from the oven and let it sit for 15 minutes before serving the dish.
